intro: Razafimandimbisonia minor, commonly known as the Madagascar star-leaf plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
